titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Joseph Williams, Thomas H. Barnes, Silas Hill, & James Maupin, Judgment
CWG9694

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Madison Circuit } Sct. December Special Term 1860.
The Commonwealth of Ky. Plaintiff
against } Summons on Forfeited bail bond No 3.
Joseph Williams, Thomas H Barnes, Silas Hill and James Maupin } Defts

The defendants Thomas H. Barnes, Silas Hill and James Maupin having been duly Summoned and failing to answer, it is considered and adjudged by the Court that the Commonwealth recover of said defendants Barnes, Hill and Maupin the sum of $500. The amount of the bail bond forefeited herein and also her costs herein expended, And the Case is continued as to the defendant Joseph Williams and an alias Summons is ordered against him herein
A Copy Test J M Shackelford C M C C
